info.title: ThingSpace Connectivity Management API
info.description: The ThingSpace Connectivity Management API allows you to add and activate devices, check their status, monitor their usage, monitor their reachability for Data and SMS communication as well as their connection status, and perform other device connectivity management tasks through a RESTful API. You can use the API to add connectivity management to anything from small apps to enterprise software systems, such as enterprise resource planning (ERP), supply chain management and customer service management. The API provides a secure, standards-compliant REST interface to the web services at the ThingSpace Data Center. You can download the JSON file here.

tags.name: Device Management
tags.description: Manage device connectivity and get device history.

tags.name: Accounts
tags.description: Get information about an account or account leads.

tags.name: SMS
tags.description: Exchange Short Message Service (SMS) messages with devices.

tags.name: Session Management
tags.description: Start and end Connectivity Management sessions.

tags.name: Connectivity Callbacks
tags.description: Manage subscriptions to asynchronous webhook messages.

tags.name: Account Requests
tags.description: Get the status of asynchronous reqeusts.

tags.name: Service Plans
tags.description: Get a list of service plans in an account.

get.description: Returns information about a specified account.
get.summary: Returns information about a specified account

200.description: The account information.

get.summary: Returns the status of an asynchronous request
get.description: Returns the current status of an asynchronous request that was made for a single device.

200.description: The asynchronous request status.

get.summary: Returns an account's custom services and states
get.description: Returns a list and details of all custom services and states defined for a specified account.

200.description: The account's engagements, services, and states.

get.description: Returns the name and endpoint URL of the callback listening services registered for a given account.
get.summary: Returns the name and endpoint URL of all callback listening services registered for a given account.

200.description: A list of callback listeners.

post.summary: Registers a URL where an account will receive RESTFul messages from a platform callback service.
post.description: You are responsible for creating and running a listening process on your server at that URL.

requestBody.description: Request to register a callback.

200.description: A success response for registering a callback.

delete.description: Stops ThingSpace from sending callback messages for the specified account and service.
delete.summary: Stops the platform from sending callback messages for the specified account and service.

200.description: Response for a request to deregister a callback.

post.summary: Activates service for one or more devices.
post.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

requestBody.description: Request for activating a service on devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Adds up to 200 new devices, without provisioning lines of service for them.
post.description: Use this API if you want to manage some device settings before you are ready to activate service for the devices.

requestBody.description: Devices to add.

200.description: For each device in the request, contains device identifiers and a success or failure response.

schema.description: Status of request to add each device.

put.summary: Changes the name and address associated with a device.
put.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the contact information has been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

requestBody.description: Request to update contact information for devices.

200.description: Request ID returned in a success response.

put.summary: Updates one or more custom field values for devices.
put.description: Sends a CarrierService callback message for each device in the request when the custom fields have been changed, or if there was a problem and the change could not be completed.

requestBody.description: Request to update custom field of devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Deactivates service for one or more devices.
post.description: Deactivating service for a device may result in an early termination fee (ETF) being charged to the account, depending on the terms of the contract with Verizon. If your contract allows ETF waivers and if you want to use one for a particular deactivation, set the etfWaiver value to True.

requestBody.description: Request to deactivate service for one or more devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Deletes up to 200 deactive devices.
post.description: Use this API to remove unneeded devices from an account.

requestBody.description: Devices to delete.

200.description: For each device in the request, contains device identifiers and a success or failure response.

example.message: The device is not in deactive state.

post.description: Returns information about a single device or information about all devices that match the given parameters. Returned information includes device provisioning state, service plan, MDN, MIN, and IP address.
post.summary: Returns information about a specified device or a list of devices in an account.

requestBody.description: Device information query.

200.description: List of devices that match the request parameters, ordered by device creation date, oldest first.

202.description: List of devices that match the request parameters, ordered by device creation date, oldest first. Additional devices remain.

post.description: Returns a list of all 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.
post.summary: Returns a list of all 4G devices with an ICCID that was not activated with the expected IMEI.

requestBody.description: Request to list devices with mismatched IMEIs and ICCIDs.

200.description: List of devices that have mismatched IMEIs and ICCIDs.

put.description: Move active devices from one billing account to another within a customer profile.

requestBody.description: Request to move devices between accounts.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

put.summary: Move devices to a new customer-defined state.
put.description: Changes the provisioning state of one or more devices to a specified customer-defined service and state.

requestBody.description: Request to change device state to one defined by the user.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

options.summary: Move devices to a new customer-defined state.
options.description: Changes the provisioning state of one or more devices to a specified customer-defined service and state for Business Internet/Fixed Wireless Access (FWA)).**Note:** This is also a "PUT".

requestBody.description: Request to change device state to one defined by the user.

filter.servicePlan: name or ID of the service plan

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

put.description: Changes the service plan for one or more devices.
put.summary: Sets a new service plan for one or more devices.

requestBody.description: Request to change device service plan.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.description: Suspends service for one or more devices.
post.summary: Suspends service for one or more devices.

requestBody.description: Request to suspend service for one or more devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.description: Restores service to one or more suspended devices.
post.summary: Restore service to one or more suspended devices.

requestBody.description: Request to restore services of one or more suspended devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Checks whether devices are available to be activated.
post.description: Checks whether specified devices are registered by the manufacturer with the Verizon network and are available to be activated.

requestBody.description: Request to check if devices can be activated or not.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Returns a list of network connection events for a device during a specified time period.
post.description: Each response includes a maximum of 500 records. To obtain more records, you can call the API multiple times, adjusting the earliest value each time to start where the previous request finished.

requestBody.description: Query to retrieve device connection history.

200.description: List of device connection events, sorted by the occurredAt timestamp, oldest first.

202.description: List of device connection events, sorted by the occurredAt timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.

put.description: Changes or removes the CostCenterCode value or customer name and address (Primary Place of Use) for one or more devices.
put.summary: Changes or removes the costCenterCode value for one or more devices.

requestBody.description: Request to update cost center code value for one or more devices.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.description: Returns extended diagnostic information about a specified device, including connectivity, provisioning, billing and location status.
post.summary: Returns basic diagnostic information about a specified device, including connectivity, provisioning, and billing status.

requestBody.description: Request to query extended diagnostics information for a device.

200.description: Device diagnostic information.

post.description: Returns the provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.
post.summary: Returns the provisioning history of a device during a specified time period.

requestBody.description: Query to obtain device provisioning history.

200.description: List of Device Provision History events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first.

schema.description: List the Provisioning History responses for a device.

202.description: List of Device Provision History events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.

schema.description: List the Provisioning History responses for a device.

post.summary: Requests the current PRL version for devices, which can help determine which devices need a PRL update.
post.description: 4G and GSM devices do not have a PRL.

requestBody.description: Request to query device PRL.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Request service suspension information about devices.
post.description: Returns DeviceSuspensionStatus callback messages containing the current device state and information on how many days a device has been suspended and can continue to be suspended.

requestBody.description: Request to obtain service suspenstion status for a device.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Obtain the usage history of a specific device.
post.description: Returns the network data usage history of a device during a specified time period.

requestBody.description: Request to obtain usage history for a specific device.

200.description: List of device usage events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first.

202.description: List of device usage events, sorted by the timestamp, oldest first. Additional events remain.

post.summary: Returns the total amount of data sent and the total number of SMS messages sent or received by a set of devices in a specified timeframe.
post.description: The information is returned in a callback response, so you must register a URL for DeviceUsage callback messages using the POST /callbacks API.

requestBody.description: A request to retrieve aggregated device usage history information.

200.description: A unique string that associates the request with the results that are sent via a callback service.

put.description: Changes the identifier of a 3G or 4G device to match hardware changes made for a line of service. Use this request to transfer the line of service and the MDN to new hardware, or to change the MDN.
put.summary: Changes the identifier of a 3G or 4G device to match hardware changes made for a line of service.

requestBody.description: Request to update device id.

200.description: A unique string that associates the request with the results that are sent via a callback service.

post.description: Create a new device group and optionally add devices to the group. Device groups can make it easier to manage similar devices and to get reports on their usage.
post.summary: Creates a new device group and optionally adds a set of devices to that group.

requestBody.description: A request to create a new device group.

200.description: Successful response, Creates a new device group.

get.description: Returns a list of all device groups in a specified account.
get.summary: Returns a list of device groups in an account

200.description: The list of device groups in the account.

example.name: Unassigned Devices
example.description: All devices that are not in another device group.

get.summary: Returns the name, description, and list of devices in a device group.
get.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /groups/{aname}/name/{gname}/?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of groups.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continue the previous query from the pageUrl pagetoken.

200.description: Successful response.

put.description: Make changes to a device group, including changing the name and description, and adding or removing devices.
put.summary: Make changes to a device group, including changing the name and description, and adding or removing devices.

requestBody.description: Request to update device group.

example.newGroupDescription: All western region tank level monitors.

200.description: Successful response.

delete.description: Deletes a device group from the account. Devices in the group are moved to the default device group and are not deleted from the account.
delete.summary: Deletes a device group. Devices in the group are moved to the default device group and are not deleted from the account.

200.description: Successful response.

get.summary: Returns information for all leads associated with the account
get.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /leads/{aname}?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of leads.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continue the previous query from the pageUrl in Location Header.

200.description: The list of leads associated with the account.

202.description: The list of leads associated with the account, additional leads remain.

get.description: Returns a list of all data service plans that are associated with a specified billing account. When you send a request to /devices/actions/activate to activate a line of service you must specify the code for one of the service plans associated with your account.
get.summary: Returns a list of all data service plans that are associated with a specified account.

200.description: The list of service plans associated with the account.

post.description: Initiates a Connectivity Management session and returns a VZ-M2M session token that is required in subsequent API requests.
post.summary: Initiates a Connectivity Management session and returns a session token required in subsequent API requests.

requestBody.description: Request to initiate a session.

200.description: VZ-M2M session token.

post.description: Ends a Connectivity Management session.
post.summary: Ends a Connectivity Management session.

200.description: VZ-M2M session token.

put.summary: Returns a new, randomly generated password for the current username
put.description: The new password is effective immediately. Passwords do not expire, but Verizon recommends changing your password every 90 days.

requestBody.description: Request with current password that needs to be reset.

200.description: Returns a new, randomly generated password for the current username.

post.summary: Sends an SMS message to one or more devices.
post.description: The messages are queued on the ThingSpace Platform and sent as soon as possible, but they may be delayed due to traffic and routing considerations.

requestBody.description: Request to send SMS.

value.smsMessage: the body or text of the message itself

value.groupName: the name of the group the device is in
value.servicePlan: the service plan the device is using
value.smsMessage: the body or text of the message itself

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

get.summary: Retrieves queued SMS messages sent by all M2M MC devices associated with an account.
get.description: When HTTP status is 202, a URL will be returned in the Location header of the form /sms/{aname}/history?next={token}. This URL can be used to request the next set of messages.

parameters.name: next
parameters.description: Continue the previous query from the URL in Location Header.

200.description: Successful response.

202.description: Successful response, additional SMS messages remain.

put.description: Tells the ThingSpace Platform to start sending mobile-originated SMS messages through the EnhancedConnectivityService callback service. SMS messages from devices are queued until they are retrieved by your application, either by callback or synchronously with GET /sms/{accountName}/history.
put.summary: Starts delivery of queued SMS messages for the specific account.

200.description: Successful response.

post.description: Uses the profile to bring the device under management.

requestBody.description: Device Profile Query

200.description: Request ID

requestBody.description: Device Profile Query

200.description: Request ID

post.description: Allows the profile to set the fallback attribute to the device.

requestBody.description: Device Profile Query

200.description: Request ID

requestBody.description: Create Reachability Report Request

200.description: Request ID
Request ID

post.summary: API for Uploading Devices to DMD.
post.description: Upload a device record

requestBody.description: Device Upload Query

200.description: Request ID

post.summary: Gets billed usage for for either multiple devices or an entire billing account.
post.description: Gets billed usage for for either multiple devices or an entire billing account.

requestBody.description: Request to list devices with mismatched IMEIs and ICCIDs.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Download a local profile to eUICC devices and enable the profile.
post.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and enables the profile.

requestBody.description: Device Profile Query

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Download a local profile to eUICC devices and leave the profile disabled.
post.description: Downloads an eUICC local profile to devices and leaves the profile disabled.

requestBody.description: Device Profile Query

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Enable a local profile on eUICC devices.
post.description: Enable a local profile that has been downloaded to eUICC devices.

requestBody.description: Update state

200.description: Request ID

post.summary: Disable a local profile on eUICC devices.
post.description: Disable a local profile on eUICC devices. The default or boot profile will become the enabled profile.

requestBody.description: Update state

200.description: Request ID

post.summary: Delete a local profile from eUICC devices.
post.description: Delete a local profile from eUICC devices. If the local profile is enabled, it will first be disabled and the boot or default profile will be enabled.

requestBody.description: Update state

200.description: Request ID

post.summary: Allow you to associate a label to a device
post.description: Allows you to associate your own usage segmentation label with a device.

requestBody.description: Request to associate a label to a device.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

delete.summary: Allow you to remove the label associated with a device.
delete.description: Allow customers to remove the associated label from a device.

parameters.name: accountName
parameters.description: The numeric name of the account.

parameters.name: LabelList
parameters.description: A list of the Label IDs to remove from the exclusion list.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Uploads and activates device.
post.description: Uploads and activates device identifiers and SKUs for new devices from OEMs to Verizon.

requestBody.description: Request to Upload and Activate device.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Check the status of real-time orders.
post.description: Checks the status of an activation order and lists where the order is in the provisioning process.

requestBody.description: The request body identifies the device and reporting period that you want included in the report.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Requests for status of device based on the request type.
post.description: If the devices do not already exist in the account, this API resource adds them before activation.

requestBody.description: Retrieve Reachability Report Status for a device.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

post.summary: Retrieve all the active monitors.
post.description: Retrieve all the active monitors.

requestBody.description: Retrieve Monitor Request.

200.description: Request ID received on a successful response.

Account.description: Returns information about a specified account.

accountName.description: The name of the account.

accountNumber.description: The billing number of the account.

organizationName.description: The name of the organization that the account is part of.

isProvisioningAllowed.description: True if devices can be added to the account and activated with a single request. False if devices must be added to the account before they can be activated.

carriers.description: The names of all carriers for the account.

items.description: The names of all carriers for the account.

features.description: The names of features that are enabled for the account.

items.description: The names of features that are enabled for the account.

iPPools.description: Array of IP pools that are available to the account.

servicePlans.description: Array of service plans that are available to the account.

state.description: The initial service state for the devices. The only valid state is “Preactive.”

devicesToAdd.description: The devices that you want to add.

accountName.description: The billing account to which the devices are added.

customFields.description: The names and values for any custom fields that you want set for the devices as they are added to the account.

groupName.description: The name of a device group to add the devices to. They are added to the default device group if you don't include this parameter.

skuNumber.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number of a 4G device type with an embedded SIM.

AddDevicesResult.description: Contains the device identifiers and a success or failure response for each device in the request.

response.description: The success message or error message for the current device.

Address.description: The customer address for the line's primary place of use, for line usage taxation.

addressLine1.description: The street address for the line's primary place of use. This must be a physical address for taxation; it cannot be a P.O. box.

city.description: The city for the line's primary place of use.

state.description: The state for the line's primary place of use.

zip.description: The ZIP code for the line's primary place of use.

zip4.description: The ZIP+4 for the line's primary place of use.

country.description: Either “US” or “USA” for the country of the line's primary place of use.

phone.description: A phone number where the customer can be reached.

phoneType.description: A single letter to indicate the customer phone type.

emailAddress.description: An email address for the customer.

ConnectivityManagementCallback.description: Includes callback listeners that were registered through the Connectivity Management API.

accountName.description: The name of the billing account for which callback messages will be sent.

password.description: The password defined when a URL was registered for the callback service, or an empty string if no password was defined.

serviceName.description: The name of the callback service, which identifies the type and format of messages that will be sent to the registered URL.

url.description: The address of the callback listening service where the ThingSpace Platform will send callback messages for the service type.

username.description: The username defined when a URL was registered for the callback service, or an empty string if no username was defined.

accountName.description: The name of the billing account.

serviceName.description: The name of the callback service that was registered/deregistered.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

devices.description: The devices for which you want to restore service, specified by device identifier.

withBilling.description: set to "true" to suspend with billing, set to "false" to suspend without billing

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to restore service for all devices in that group.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

device.description: The device Id for which you want to get the status of the notification report.

requestExpirationTime.description: The time at which the request expires.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

devices.description: The devices for which you want to restore service, specified by device identifier.

monitorType.description: The name of a billing account.

devices.description: Up to 10,000 devices for which you want to activate service, specified by device identifier.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that you want to assign to all specified devices.

mdnZipCode.description: The Zip code of the location where the line of service will primarily be used, or a Zip code that you have been told to use with these devices. For accounts that are configured for geographic numbering, this is the ZIP code from which the MDN will be derived.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

carrierIpPoolName.description: The private IP pool (Carrier Group Name) from which your device IP addresses will be derived.

carrierName.description: The carrier that will perform the activation.

costCenterCode.description: A string to identify the cost center that the device is associated with.

customFields.description: A user-defined descriptive field, limited to 50 characters.

groupName.description: If you specify devices by ID in the devices parameters, this is the name of a device group that the devices should be added to.If you don't specify individual devices with the devices parameter, you can provide the name of a device group to activate all devices in that group.

leadId.description: The ID of a “Qualified” or “Closed - Won” VPP customer lead, which is used with other values to determine MDN assignment, taxation, and compensation.

publicIpRestriction.description: For devices with static IP addresses on the public network, this specifies whether the devices have general access to the Internet.

skuNumber.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) of a 4G device type can be used with ICCID device identifiers in lieu of an IMEI when activating 4G devices. The SkuNumber will be used with all devices in the request, so all devices must be of the same type.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

devices.description: The devices for which you want to deactivate service, specified by device identifier.

reasonCode.description: Code identifying the reason for the deactivation. Currently the only valid reason code is “FF”, which corresponds to General Admin/Maintenance.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

etfWaiver.description: Fees may be assessed for deactivating Verizon Wireless devices, depending on the account contract. The etfWaiver parameter waives the Early Termination Fee (ETF), if applicable.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to deactivate all devices in that group.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

carrierName.description: The carrier that will perform the activation. This parameter is only required if you have more than one carrier.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that is assigned to the device.

state.description: The device state. Valid values include: Activate, Suspend, Deactive, Pre-active.

ChangeDeviceIdRequest.description: Changes the identifier of a 3G or 4G device to match hardware changes made for a line of service. Use this request to transfer the line of service and the MDN to new hardware, or to change the MDN.

assignNonGeoMdn.description: Set to true to assign a non-Geo MDN and MSISDN, or false to assign an MDN and MSISDN from a specific NPA-NXX.

change4gOption.description: The type of change that you want to make for a 4G device.

deviceIds.description: The device that you want to change, specified by a device identifier.

deviceIdsTo.description: The new identifier for the device. Required for all change4GOptions except ChangeMSISDN.

npaNxx.description: The NPA NXX (area code and prefix) from which the MDN and MSISDN will be derived when assignNonGeoMDN is false. Specify the 6-digit NPA NXX of the location where the line of service will primarily be used. This API checks to see if a number starting with the NPA NXX is available. If not, this API uses the zipCode parameter, if specified, to assign a number in the area of the line of service. This parameter is required when you change an MDN/MSISDN for a B2B carrier, such as Verizon Wireless.

servicePlan.description: The code for a different service plan, if you want to change the service plan while changing the device identifier. Set this parameter to one of the Code values returned by GET /plans.

zipCode.description: The ZIP code from which the MDN and MSISDN will be derived when assignNonGeoMDN is true. Specify the zip code of the location where the line of service will primarily be used.

ConnectionEvent.description: Network connection events for a device during a specified time period.

connectionEventAttributes.description: The attributes that describe the connection event.

occurredAt.description: The date and time when the connection event occured.

ConnectionHistoryResult.description: Response containing the connection history. It is a list of Network Connection Events for a device.

connectionHistory.description: Device connection events, sorted by the occurredAt timestamp, oldest first.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved. Send another request, adjusting the earliest value in the request based on the occuredAt value for the last device in the current response.

accountName.description: The name of the billing account that the devices belong to. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

devices.description: A list of the devices that you want to change, specified by device identifier. You only need to provide one identifier per device. Do not include accountName, groupName, customFields, or servicePlan if you use this parameter.

CreateDeviceGroupRequest.description: Create request for a new device group and optionally add devices to the group.

accountName.description: The Verizon billing account that the device group will belong to. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

groupDescription.description: A description for the device group.

groupName.description: The name for the new device group. This name must be unique within the specified account.

devicesToAdd.description: Zero or more devices to add to the device group. You can use POST /devices/actions/list to get a list of all devices in the account.

CustomerName.description: The customer name to be used for line usage taxation.

title.description: An optional title for the customer, such as “Mr.” or “Dr.”

suffix.description: An optional suffix for the customer name, such as “Jr.” or “III.”

CustomFieldsUpdateRequest.description: Request to assign or change custom field values for one or more devices.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.This parameter is only required if the UWS account used for the current API session has access to multiple billing accounts.An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

customFieldsToUpdate.description: The names and new values of any custom fields that you want to change.

devices.description: The devices that you want to change.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to only include devices in that group.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

earliest.description: Only include devices that were added after this date and time.

latest.description: Only include devices that were added before this date and time.

DeleteDevicesRequest.description: Request to delete a device request.

devicesToDelete.description: A list of up to 100 devices that you want to delete, specified by device identifier. You only need to provide one identifier per device.

accountName.description: The Verizon billing account that the device group belongs to. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

DeleteDevicesResult.description: Response for a request made to delete a device.

deviceIds.description: One object per device to be deleted. Each object must contain a kind and id element identifying the device.

status.description: “Success” if the device was deleted, or “Failed” if there was a problem.

message.description: Not present if status=Success. One of these messages if status=Failed:The device is not in deactivate state.The user does not have access to delete the device.
message.example: The device is not in deactive state.

ThingspaceDevice.description: Device that exist in Verizon Mobile Device Management (MDM).

accountName.description: The billing account that the device is associated with.

billingCycleEndDate.description: The date that the device's current billing cycle ends.

carrierInformations.description: The carrier information associated with the device.

connected.description: True if the device is connected; false if it is not.

createdAt.description: The date and time that the device was added to the system.

customFields.description: The custom fields and values that have been set for the device.

extendedAttributes.description: Any extended attributes for the device, as Key and Value pairs. The pairs listed below are returned as part of the response for a single device, but are not included if the request was for information about multiple devices.

groupNames.description: The device groups that the device belongs to.

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the device.

lastActivationBy.description: The user who last activated the device.

lastActivationDate.description: The date and time that the device was last activated.

lastConnectionDate.description: The most recent connection date and time.

DeviceAggregateUsageListRequest.description: Request to list device aggregate usage.

startTime.description: The beginning of the reporting period. The startTime cannot be more than 6 months before the current date.

endTime.description: The end of the reporting period. The endTime date must be within on month of the startTime date.

deviceIds.description: One or more devices for which you want aggregate data, specified by device ID.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to only include devices in that group.

DeviceConnectionListRequest.description: Request to list of network connection events for a device during a specified time period.

earliest.description: The earliest date and time for which you want connection events.

latest.description: The last date and time for which you want connection events.

DeviceCostCenterRequest.description: Request to retrieve cost center value of a device.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

costCenter.description: The new cost center code. Valid values are any string of up to 36 alphanumeric characters, space, dash, exclamation point, and pound sign.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

devices.description: A list of the devices that you want to change, specified by device identifier. Do not include accountName, groupName, customFields, or servicePlan if you use this parameter.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to only include devices in that group.

primaryPlaceOfUse.description: The customer name and the address of the device's primary place of use. These values are applied to all devices in the request.The Primary Place of Use location may affect taxation or have other legal implications. You may want to speak with legal and/or financial advisers before entering values for these fields.

removeCostCenter.description: Set to true to remove the cost center code value. This flag takes precedence over a new costCenter value. If this flag is true and costCenter has a value, the cost center code is removed. Do not include this parameter, or set it to false to change the costCenter value.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

DeviceExtendedDiagnosticsRequest.description: Request for obtaining device extended diagnostics.

accountName.description: The Verizon billing account that the device belongs to. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

deviceList.description: The device for which you want diagnostic information, specified by the device's MDN.

DeviceExtendedDiagnosticsResult.description: Result for a request to obtain device extended diagnostics.

categories.description: The response includes various types of information about the device, grouped into categories. Each category object contains the category name and a list of Extended Attribute objects as key-value pairs.

DeviceFilter.description: Specify the kind of the device identifier, the type of match, and the string that you want to match.

account.description: The the billing account that the devices belong to.

groupName.description: Only include devices that are in this device group.

servicePlan.description: Only include devices that have this service plan.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

groupName.description: Only include devices that are in this device group.

servicePlan.description: Only include devices that have this service plan.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

DeviceId.description: An identifier for a single device.

id.description: The value of the device identifier.

contains.description: The string appears anywhere in the identifer.

startswith.description: The identifer must start with the specified string.

endswith.description: The identifier must end with the specified string.

DeviceKind.description: The type of the device identifier. Valid types of identifiers are:ESN (decimal),EID,ICCID (up to 20 digits),IMEI (up to 16 digits),MDN,MEID (hexadecimal),MSISDN.

AccountDeviceList.description: A list of deviceId objects to use when requesting information from multiple devices.

AccountDeviceListFilter.description: Filter for a list of devices.

deviceIdentifierFilters.description: Specify the kind of the device identifier, the type of match, and the string that you want to match.

accountName.description: The billing account for which a list of devices is returned. If you don't specify an accountName, the list includes all devices to which you have access.

currentState.description: The name of a device state, to only include devices in that state.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

earliest.description: Only include devices that were added after this date and time.

groupName.description: Only include devices that are in this device group.

latest.description: Only include devices that were added before this date and time.

servicePlan.description: Only include devices that have this service plan.

AccountDeviceListResult.description: Response for a request to list down account devices.

devices.description: Up to 10,000 devices that you want to move to a different account, specified by device identifier.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved.

DeviceActivationRequest.description: Request for device status to check availability of activation.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

devices.description: Up to 10,000 devices that you want to move to a different account, specified by device identifier.

DevicePrlListRequest.description: Requests the current PRL (Preferred Roaming List) version for 2G or 3G devices, which can help determine which devices need a PRL update. (4G and GSM devices do not have a PRL.).

deviceIds.description: The devices for which you want the PRL version, specified by device identifier. You only need to provide one identifier per device. Do not use any of the other parameters if you specify device IDs.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account. This parameter is only required if you are passing groupName and the UWS account used for the current API session has access to multiple billing accounts, because the same device group name can exist in multiple accounts.An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

customFields.description: The names and values of custom fields, if you want to only include devices that have matching custom fields.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to only include devices in that group.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

DeviceMismatchListRequest.description: Request to list of all 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.

devices.description: A list of specific devices that you want to check, specified by ICCID or MDN.

accountName.description: The account that you want to search for mismatched devices. If you don't specify an accountName, the search includes all devices to which you have access.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, to only include devices in that group.

DeviceMismatchListResult.description: Response to list of all 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.

devices.description: A list of specific devices that you want to check, specified by ICCID or MDN.

DeviceProvisioningHistoryListRequest.description: Request to return the provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

earliest.description: The earliest date and time for which you want provisioning data.

latest.description: The last date and time for which you want provisioning data.

DeviceProvisioningHistoryListResult.description: Response to return the provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved.

provisioningHistory.description: The provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

DeviceSuspensionStatusRequest.description: Request to return service suspension information about one or more devices.

deviceIds.description: The devices that you want to include in the request, specified by device identifier. You only need to provide one identifier per device.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

DeviceUsageListRequest.description: Request to return the daily network data usage of a single device during a specified time period.

earliest.description: The earliest date for which you want usage data.

latest.description: The last date for which you want usage data.

DeviceUsageListResult.description: Response to return the daily network data usage of a single device during a specified time period.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved.

DiagnosticsCategory.description: Various types of information about the device, grouped into categories. Each category object contains the category name and a list of Extended Attribute objects as key-value pairs.

extendedAttributes.description: A list of Extended Attribute objects as key-value pairs.

Engagement.description: The engagements associated with the account.

services.description: The services associated with the account.

AccountStatesAndServices.description: Returns a list and details of all custom services and states defined for a specified account.

engagement.description: The engagements associated with the account.

GoToStateRequest.description: Changes the provisioning state of one or more devices to a specified customer-defined service and state.

serviceName.description: The name of a customer-defined service to push the devices to.

stateName.description: The name of a customer-defined stage state to push the devices to.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that you want to assign to all specified devices in the new state.

mdnZipCode.description: The Zip code of the location where the line of service will primarily be used, or a Zip code that you have been told to use with these devices. For accounts that are configured for geographic numbering, this is the ZIP code from which the MDN will be derived.

devices.description: Up to 10,000 devices that you want to push to a different state, specified by device identifier.

carrierIpPoolName.description: The pool from which your device IP addresses will be derived if the service or state change requires new IP addresses.If you do not include this element, the default pool will be used.

publicIpRestriction.description: For devices with static IP addresses on the public network, this specifies whether the devices have general access to the Internet. Valid values are “restricted” or “unrestricted”.

skuNumber.description: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU) number of a 4G device type with an embedded SIM. Can be used with ICCID or EID device identifiers in lieu of an IMEI when activating 4G devices. The SkuNumber will be used with all devices in the request, so all devices must be of the same type.

customFields.description: The names and values of any custom fields that you want to set for the devices.

devicesWithServiceAddress.description: This is an array that associates an IP address with a device identifier. This variable is only relevant for Business Internet/Fixed Wireless Access

ipAddress.description: The IP address of the device.

groupName.description: The name of a device group that the devices should be added to.

DeviceGroupDevicesData.description: Returns the name, description, and list of devices in a device group.

description.description: The description of the device group.

devices.description: The devices in the device group.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved.

name.description: The name of the device group.

DeviceGroup.description: Returns a list of all device groups in a specified account.

description.description: The description of the device group.
description.example: All devices that are not in another device group.

extendedAttributes.description: Any extended attributes for the device group, as Key and Value pairs.

name.description: The name of the device group.

example.name: Unassigned Devices
example.description: All devices that are not in another device group.

DeviceGroupUpdateRequest.description: Make changes to a device group, including changing the name and description, and adding or removing devices.

devicesToAdd.description: Zero or more devices to add to the device group, specified by device ID. The devices will be removed from their current device groups. You can use POST /devices/actions/list to get a list of all devices in the account.

devicesToRemove.description: Zero or more devices to remove from the device group, specified by device ID. The devices will be added to the default device group.

newGroupDescription.description: A new description for the device group. Do not include this parameter to leave the group description unchanged.
newGroupDescription.example: All western region tank level monitors

newGroupName.description: A new name for the device group. Do not include this parameter if you want to leave the group name unchanged.

example.newGroupDescription: All western region tank level monitors.

IPPool.description: IP pool that is available to the account.

poolName.description: The name of the IP pool.

poolType.description: The type of IP pool, such as “Static IP” or “Dynamic IP.”

isDefaultPool.description: True if this is the default IP pool for the account.

CustomFields.description: Custom data that can be included using key-value pairs.

key.description: The key for an extended attribute.

value.description: The value of an extended attribute.

AccountLeadsResult.description: Returns information for all leads associated with an account.

hasMoreData.description: False if no more leads.True if there is more data to be retrieved.

leads.description: The leads associated with an account.

AccountLead.description: A successful response returns an array of lead objects.

leadId.description: Unique number for each lead. Use this value in the leadId parameter when activating devices to credit the activations to the lead.

leadState.description: The current state of the lead, such as “Qualified” or “Closed.”

LogInRequest.description: Request to initiate a Connectivity Management session and returns a VZ-M2M session token that is required in subsequent API requests.

LogInResult.description: Response to initiate a Connectivity Management session and returns a VZ-M2M session token that is required in subsequent API requests.

sessionToken.description: The identifier for the session that was created by the request. Store the sessionToken for use in the header of all other API requests.

LogOutRequest.description: Request to end a Connectivity Management session.

sessionToken.description: The session token is returned to confirm that it was invalidated.

MismatchedDevice.description: 4G devices with an ICCID (SIM) that was not activated with the expected IMEI (hardware) during a specified time frame.

accountName.description: The account that the device is associated with.

mdn.description: The assigned phone number of the device.

activationDate.description: The date and time when the SIM was last activated.

preImei.description: The IMEI of the device prior to the SIM OTA activation on simOtaDate.

postImei.description: The IMEI of the device after the SIM OTA activation on simOtaDate.

simOtaDate.description: The date and time of the SIM OTA activation.

MoveDeviceRequest.description: Request to move active devices from one billing account to another within a customer profile.

accountName.description: The name of the billing account that you want to move the devices to.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

devices.description: Up to 10,000 devices that you want to move to a different account, specified by device identifier.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, to only include devices in that group.

carrierIpPoolName.description: The pool from which device IP addresses will be derived in the new account. If you do not include this element, the default pool will be used.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that you want to assign to the devices in the new account. If you do not include this element, ThingSpace will attempt to use the current service plan, which will result in a error if the new account does not have that service plan.

PlaceOfUse.description: The customer name and the address of the device's primary place of use. Leave these fields empty to use the account profile address as the primary place of use. These values will be applied to all devices in the request.If the account is enabled for non-geographic MDNs and the device supports it, the primaryPlaceOfUse address will also be used to derive the MDN for the device.

ProvisioningHistory.description: The provisioning history of a specified device during a specified time period.

occurredAt.description: The date and time when the provisioning event occured.

status.description: The success or failure of the provisioning event.

eventBy.description: The user who performed the provisioning event.

mdn.description: The MDN assigned to the device after the provisioning event.

msisdn.description: The MSISDN assigned to the device after the provisioning event.

servicePlan.description: The service plan of the device after the provisioning event occurred.

extendedAttributes.description: Any extended attributes for the event, as Key and Value pairs.

name.description: The name of the callback service that you want to subscribe to.

url.description: The address on your server where you have enabled a listening service for callback messages.

username.description: The user name that the M2M Platform should return in the callback messages.

password.description: The password that the M2M Platform should return in the callback messages.

DeviceManagementResult.description: Response to activate service for one or more devices so that they can send and receive data.

requestId.description: A unique string that associates the request with the results that are sent via a callback service.

RequestStatus.description: The current status of the callback response.

AsynchronousRequestResult.description: A successful request returns the request ID and the current status.

requestId.description: The unique ID of the asynchronous request.

success.description: A value of “true” indicates that the device group was created successfully.

name.description: The name of the service plan.

description.description: The description of the service plan.

states.description: The state of the service plan.

carrierServicePlanCode.description: The code that is used by the carrier for the service plan.

code.description: The code of the service plan, which may not be the same as the name.

extendedAttributes.description: Any extended attributes for the service plan, as Key and Value pairs.

name.description: The name of the service plan.

sizeKb.description: The size of the service plan in kilobytes.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that you want to assign to all specified devices.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

currentServicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

customFields.description: Custom field names and values, if you want to only include devices that have matching values.

devices.description: A list of the devices that you want to change, specified by device identifier.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to restore service for all devices in that group.

SessionResetPasswordRequest.description: Request to a new, randomly generated password for the current username.

oldPassword.description: The current password for the username.

SessionResetPasswordResult.description: Response to a new, randomly generated password for the current username.

newPassword.description: The new password for the username.

SMSMessage.description: SMS messages sent by all M2M devices associated with a billing account.

deviceIds.description: One or more IDs of the device that sent the message.

message.description: The contents of the SMS message.

timestamp.description: The date and time that the message was received by the Verizon ThingSpace Platform.

SMSMessagesQueryResult.description: Response to SMS messages sent by all M2M devices associated with a billing account.

hasMoreData.description: False for a status 200 response.True for a status 202 response, indicating that there is more data to be retrieved.

messages.description: An array of up to 100 SMS messages that were sent by devices in the account.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account.

smsMessage.description: The contents of the SMS message. The SMS message is limited to 160 characters in 7-bit format, or 140 characters in 8-bit format.
smsMessage.example: The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain.

customFields.description: The names and values of custom fields, if you want to only include devices that have matching custom fields.

dataEncoding.description: The SMS message encoding, which can be 7-bit (default), 8-bit-ASCII, 8-bit-UTF-8, 8-bit-DATA.

deviceIds.description: The devices that you want to send the message to, specified by device identifier.

groupName.description: The name of a device group, if you want to send the SMS message to all devices in the device group.

servicePlan.description: The name of a service plan, if you want to only include devices that have that service plan.

timeToLive.description: A period of time the message remains valid or an end date for the message. This value would be less than the 5 day default.

example.smsMessage: The rain in Spain stays mainly in the plain.

workflowSequenceNumber.description: The workflow sequence number of this state.

servicePlans.description: The service plans that can be used to charge for services for devices in this state.

Usage.description: The daily network data usage of a single device during a specified time period.

bytesUsed.description: The number of bytes that the device sent or received on the report date.

extendedAttributes.description: The number of mobile-originated and mobile-terminated SMS messages on the report date.

servicePlan.description: The list of service plans associated with the device/account.

smsUsed.description: The number of SMS messages that were sent or received on the report date.

source.description: The source of the information for the reported usage.

timestamp.description: The date of the recorded usage.

carrierName.example: the name of the mobile service provider

carrierIpPoolName.description: The name of the pool of IP addresses assigned to the profile.

reasonCode.example: a short code for the reason action was taken

carrierName.example: the name of the mobile service provider
the name of the mobile service provider

billedusageListRequest.description: Information required to associate a usage segmentation label with a device to retrieve billing.

DeviceLabels.description: A label for a single device.

name.description: The label you want to associate with the device.

AccountLabels.description: Maximum of 2,000 objects are allowed in the array.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

UploadsActivatesDeviceRequest.description: The request body identifies the devices to upload.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

emailAddress.description: The email address that the report should be sent to when the upload is complete.

deviceSku.description: The stock keeping unit that identifies the type of devices in the upload and activation.

uploadType.description: The format of the device identifiers in the upload and activation.

servicePlan.description: The service plan code that you want to assign to all specified devices.

carrierIpPoolName.description: The pool from which your device IP addresses is derived.

mdnZipCode.description: The Zip code of the location where the line of service is primarily used, or a Zip code that you have been told to use with these devices.

devices.description: The devices to upload, specified by device IDs in a format matching uploadType.

CheckOrderStatusRequest.description: The request body identifies the devices to upload.

accountName.description: The name of a billing account. An account name is usually numeric, and must include any leading zeros.

orderRequestId.description: The request id from the activation order.

devices.description: The devices to upload, specified by device IDs in a format matching uploadType.

VZ-M2M-Token.name: VZ-M2M-Token
VZ-M2M-Token.description: M2M Session Token ([How to generate an M2M session token?]($e/Session%20Management/StartConnectivityManagementSession))
